question: Sara has almost finished this crossword and just has 7 down left to fill in. The clue is: Investigate. Which of these is the correct answer?
explanationText: Only EXPLORE fits in the crossword grid at 7 down.

question: Spot the difference between these two images.
answer: The image on the right has an extra dog
explanationText: Look carefully at the bottom right corner of the images.

question: Which of these is incorrect?
explanationText: Change the images to words to make new compound words. DUCKLONGING is not a word, while the others form: BOOKING (book + king), STARFISH (star + fish), and BOOKEND (book + end).

question: Although some have been rotated, which two of these flags are exactly the same?
explanationText: Flags A and C are identical when you account for rotation.

question: Eight people are in a circle, either standing up (U) or sitting down (D) as shown below. Everyone who is standing up sits down and vice versa. How many people are now standing?
explanationText: There were 5 people sitting down initially (D), and they all stand up after the switch.

question: What connects these four things?
explanationText: Atlas (neck vertebra), Achilles (tendon), Trapeze (trapezius muscle), and Hamstring are all anatomical terms.

question: In six ball overs, a bowler can bowl a maximum of 36 balls without any extras. The bowler took these wickets: 15th ball, 21st ball, 27th ball, 29th ball. On which over was the 4th wicket taken?
explanationText: The 29th ball falls in the 5th over (balls 25-30).

question: Using the same rule for all three, fill in the blank.
explanationText: The pattern involves the last letter of each word. The sequence creates FISH → HARE → EAGLE → HORSE.

question: If it takes Isla five minutes to saw through a log, how long will it take her to saw a log into three equal pieces?
explanationText: To cut a log into 3 pieces requires 2 cuts. Each cut takes 5 minutes, so 2 × 5 = 10 minutes.

question: A fruit bowl contains four apples, three oranges and eight bananas. Dave takes two pieces of fruit at random. What is the probability that he takes two different types of fruit?
explanationText: Total fruits = 15. Probability of same type = P(2 apples) + P(2 oranges) + P(2 bananas) = 6/105 + 3/105 + 28/105 = 37/105. Probability of different types = 1 - 37/105 = 68/105. Simplified: 64/105.

question: Below is a word search containing ONLY the 12 months of the year. All the words have been found apart from one. Which month is missing?
explanationText: After finding all other months in the word search grid, MARCH is the only one not present.

question: In a tennis tournament, 111 players entered. It's a straight knock out tournament. How many matches must be played to determine a winner?
explanationText: In a knockout tournament, each match eliminates exactly one player. To go from 111 players to 1 winner, 110 players must be eliminated, requiring 110 matches.
